reviewText:
Early Access Review

Is it fun? Yeah. But there's quite a few glaring issues that I can see so far... Gonna keep this brief.

Pros:
It's cute
It's fast-paced and engaging
It's nostalgic, reminding me of the flash shooters I used to play

Cons:
The Default Weapon: This thing is ... It's meh. It feels like they're punishing you for respawning with this thing, and there's no replacement like there is with other weapons. So you can't personalize this thing, and if anyone has a pick-up weapon, you're more or less ♥♥♥♥ed. The basic gun should be, well, basic, but not inferior in functionality.

Could use some tweaks.. The Grenade Launcher is Godly, Snipers are, hit or miss.. You hit and win, or miss and die.. Rocket launchers: I've seen too many people just rush to shoot these in my face...
Powerups: Well, most of these are alright. The Ice thing feels a bit useless, and the electric shock powerup takes a while to activate for not much in terms of payoff.. Then Invisibility lets you kick someone's teeth in with minimal retaliation capacity...

The Shop: Yes, you can potentially get everything by playing, but it seems they want to limit HOW MUCH you can get in your total amount of play time for free. You get Bits"
date: which are the currency for everything
hoursPlayed: for cosmetics/weapons. Except the weapons are mixed in with the cosmetics
voteText: you only get 10 bits per LEVEL UP
helpfulPercent:
and it takes 200 bits in order to afford to gamble for the slim chance at a new weapon to equip.


Can I recommend this game? Not yet
column16: 15 of 20 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The best way to put it is I have a love/hate relationship with this game.
Mechanics wise, it's extremely similar to a flash game I used to play called Raze- in essence, it's a 8 man murderfest. You have your standard (Team) Deathmatch, and also a unique mode called collectors
date:
where you need to kill enemies, collect their power and deposit it at a bank. And this is where the love/hate comes in.

Collectors can be extremely fun when the teams are equal- but usually, they aren't. A lot of the players have a mentality where if they join a game they can't die. Ever. You'll see a person come in, get shot a few times, and then leave. This applies to any gamemode, but Collectors is where it hurts the most. You'll need people on the defensive, taking energy from the enemy's core, but also people on the defense making sure people don't steal any from yours. So whenever this balance is broken, the game becomes unfair. During a 4v4, getting an ultra kill is extremely satisfying- but if it's some 3v2 where our team is kicking ♥♥♥, it just kinda loses its fun for both me and the enemies. My teamates might like it, who knows? In the Deathmatch modes, people leaving is a bit less of an issue unless it turns into a 1v3 or something.

All this, I can deal with- I'll get a little mad, sure, but that's only a few games. But there's one issue, a glaring one that's an absolute pain and is in every match. All the players are de-synced.
You can get hit by bullets meters away from you, you can get killed by people not even on the same elevation as you, and that's whenever I really question why this is a thing. I can get lag and some teleporting or rubberbanding, but this desync is absolutely insane and really ruins the game whenever I manage to swan dive through an enemy's bullets flawlessly, but apparently one hit me and I'm god damn dead. This is especially annoying with the 1-Hit Kill rocket launchers, which you can see the rockets perfectly fine, but even if you're miles above it, you're dead because of it. This way of dealing with lag in a PvP game like this is a way to make you mad due to stray bullets counting as hits.

I know I spoke really negatively about the game, but whenever the players have an equal skill level and the lag isn't too noticeable, the game is EXTREMELY fun. It can degrade to absolute madness at times that's left me in stitches, though some of the unlockable weapons are a bit unbalanced. For example, the Minigun can rip things to shreds in seconds, and the shuriken gun thing's shuriken mines last a little too long. Other than that, the weapons are pretty nicely balanaced and seem to encourage getting the jump and flanking enemies as most of them can kill pretty quickly. Though variety in the starting weapons would be nice, or at least make it viable enough so you don't die as soon as you spawn.

All in all, this game has a lot of good, but hampered by a small but significant amount of bad. It's also pretty cheap. Though, it hasn't garnered much of a following yet, and I'm fearful that the community might die out within its early months.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Something that may surprise you is the fact that I haven’t played many arena multiplayer shooters in years. It was a phase that I thoroughly enjoyed at the end of my teenage years when I was fortunate enough to get in on the original Quake titles and similar titles from the late 1990’s. The Internet was ♥♥♥♥ back then in Australia as most people were limited to dial up. I imagine that some of you would have no idea how some games worked back then given the speed limitations. But we managed and we enjoyed what we had. LAN parties were much more popular then if you had a set up supporting one. Thankfully friends would occasionally bring their rigs and we’d party on for hours playing the best games of that era. But it’s long ago. We’ve all grown up in the intervening years and most of us, including myself, don’t live anywhere close to the same area. Thankfully high speed Internet makes playing games such as Holodrive not only possible but a reality.

And the reality of playing Holodrive struck me within my very first matches.  Although Holodrive has its own concepts that make it a unique game I couldn’t help the fact that I was reminiscing a time that I thought was lost. It wasn’t the same friends that I had come to know and love – and love to kill when playing – but it didn’t need to be. I had forgotten just how fun a game such as this could be. I had played a number of online games in the years since my arena shooter days but for the most part they were of the MMRPG games such as EverQuest, World of Warcraft, etc.  It’s safe to say that Holodrive is an ode to some of the best gaming experiences of my life and for that I am quite grateful.

The game itself is extremely fun. The action is fast and furious. You’ll die – unless you’re insanely talented – and just as quickly you’ll be killing the ever loving ♥♥♥♥ out of your enemies. I won my first game in deathmatch mode but before the final scores flashed up on the screen when the game had finished I was certain that I had gotten my ♥♥♥ kicked and I’d have been more than happy with a mid table finish. Color me shocked when I saw the final score. It’s that type of game at the early levels. I can’t write about the advanced levels because I haven’t played the game long enough to experience the ‘end game’ but if all you are after is some casual fun and you love multiplayer shooters then there’s no reason for you not to pick this game up.

I don’t generally like games that get given away on FAILMID (that’s not where I got my copy from, I got it from the developer directly as per usual) because they’re given away in such mass quantity and is a sign of a troubled game or product but I have to say that this time it is precisely why that site exists. It got players enmasse playing their game very quickly and helped them develop a community. I have yet to speak to anyone before, during or following a game but the games that I played have been filled with more players than bots and this is a great sign for the game.

I’ve treasured my short experience thus far with Holodrive and thoroughly recommend it. I can’t wait to play more. My name in game is Steamified so if you see me please say hello.

Visit Steamified[www.steamified.com] for more reviews and our epic giveaways

First of all, thank you BitCake Studio for giving me a chance to play this wonderful game for FREE as a beta tester.
This Game is spectacular, mixing both platform and shooter genre, it reminds me of the nostalgic Flash Player era.
The idea for the game is pretty much amazing, this has a lot of potential to it, the graphics are quite cool and the character is perfectly customizable with skins and outfits, there is a vast range of gun types to use and the game is Overwhelmingly Enjoyable. A great game to recommend.
One thing that the game lacks and should be inserted is the Gamemode selection at the lobby, you can only choose after a match, but for the rest I find it perfectly fine.


Heads up developers! continue working on this awesome project.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Holodrive is a nice little fast paced 2D side scroller shooter where you play as little cute robots that love explosions.
If you loved playing games like Teeworlds, Raze or Plazma Burst, you'll definitely love Holodrive as well.

As for the pros and cons

Pros:
+ Nice graphics
+ Has microtransactions, but only for visuals, game is not P2W in any way. (Taking in consideration that this will be F2P at some point)
+ Great gunplay and mechanics. 7 different types of weapons, each with their own strenghts and weaknesses. Weapons also have different variants which can be unlocked. There are also a lot of different powerups which can be picked up.
+ Simple and easy to learn.

Cons:
- Lag and poor optimization. This is a big one. It's just frustrating to get killed by bullets which didn't actually hit you. Players sometimes are rubberbanding around the map which is annoying. It gets to the point where it ruins all the fun and you can't enjoy playing the game because it's a massive lagfest.


All in all, I still recommend this game. It can be a lot of fun at the times when it doesn't lag like crazy. Hopefully this will get fixed as the game progresses further. As well as more content, curently it's a bit shy on the gamemodes and maps, but I didn't list it as a con becase I trust that there's going to be a lot more content as the game reaches it's final stages of Early Access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you like arena multiplayer games then you should give Holodrive a try. To begin with this game is pure fun with fast and furious skilled action. It has good graphics and a lot of cosmetics that you can acquire either through playing matches or buying packs. Despite the pretty graphics the game doesn’t provide you with a lot of options to change the settings as it only has the preset options. It doesn’t support borderless window mode or an ability to resize the game screen. The game itself is pretty simple. It’s all about mouse movement and precision with different types of weapons and power ups but the developers didn’t economy a time a tutorial that explains every weapon, what they do and how they should be used so that’s a big plus for me as previous Early Access games that I’ve played didn’t include tips or a tutorial. There are only several minor issues that I found which is just personal preferences. I did not discover anything game breaking that would cause me to stop playing.

PROS:Fast-paced – ( medium maps,3v3 probably that’s the most people I’ve encountered so far maybe it can go up more but there’s no chance of getting bored as there is no time to rest and there’s no where you can hide and camp you are always dragged into the action)

Graphics – ( even though you can’t customize anything the game has eye catchy graphics)

Cosmetics – (It makes game more funny and enjoyble that you can customize your character and all it takes to gain the cosmetics is that you just have to play game)

Weapons – (there’s couple of weapons that take completely different styles to play which makes it more entertaining)

Length – ( matches doesn’t last too long, they last exactly a satisfactory length and then make you wanna hop into another)
CONS:Missing Cons – (i haven't encoured anything like that,so im just saying it just to let everyone know that i'm not missing anything,i just couldn't find anything to brag about,i've seen some people whining about connection issues,but i personally haven't experienced anything like that)

This review is part of the Steamified[www.steamified.com] Community Reviews. I received this game for free thanks to Steamified and the developer. If you'd like to contribute your own reviews check out our Steam Group.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis has to be one of the funnest games to be put on Steam in a while. With the amount of cosmetics there are you can make amazing combinations. To put Holodrive in perspective it is a two dimensional platformer multiplayer shooter where you play as robots with a variety of weapons. A plus is also buying the early supporter pack for the price of the base game because you get to copies of the game to so you can give one to a friend. It also gives you a ton of coins so you can get cosmetics and new weaons right off the bat like I did with the shiruken launcher. Overall, Holodrive is an amazing game, but some weapons need to be balanced a bit more like the shotgun because I can grab it and get an average of 5 kills without running out of ammo where with the rarer weapons I can only get 2 or 3 at most. This is the greatest game and everyone who dislikes it is a quitter or is just trying to play the wrong type of game that suits them.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Lots of potential, but so far they're kinda blowing it. Early access review, so take it with a grain of salt- but long story short, I don't have much hope for the long term success of this game.

The devs claim it's not a pay-to-win game, but that's not actually true. In Holodrive, you earn an in-game currency called bits" that you can use to purchase additional items to customize your bot. You earn bits by playing the game
date: getting XP and leveling up. You can also earn bits by doing daily missions
recommended: things like that. You use the bits to buy item blind-packs called holopacks
hoursPlayed: and in each one is an item that you can equip on your bot. I know what you're saying- "oh no
voteText: in game currency!". Hang on- that's not the real problem.. in-game currency by itself does not make a game pay-to-win.\n\nPart of the problem is that some of these items skew the balance of the game in a PROFOUND way. IE) there's a rocket launcher that fires through walls
helpfulPercent: rapid fire machine gun that ricochets off of everything
votesHelpful: flamethrower that does an obscene amount of damage over time
votesFunny: and by the way most of these upgraded weapons do a LOT more damage than their non-powered counterparts. That said
commentsCount: that by itself isn't the root of the problem. Players need to be rewarded for their hard work
column16: right? Giving super experienced players uberpowerful weapons is kind of lame if you're trying to sustain a community of new players
column17: but fundamentally I get it.\n\nThe real problem is that you can buy bits using real money. Yes
column18:
microtransactions. Everybody's favorite feature. This means that you can spend a wad of cash to essentially buy the items you want- and dominate everyone else with overpowered weapons. THAT is why Holodrive is pay-to-win by even the most forgiving definition. If these items were 100% cosmetic I would have no problem with microtransactions- but they're not.

With that out of the way lets talk about the problems with the actual game:

First
column19: they drop you in without explaining ANYTHING. The tutorial tells you things you should already know if you have a steam acount and a pulse. "Hey
column20: heres how you shoot. Here's WASD movement. Here's how you tie your shoes". I hate tutorials like this because somebody spent real time working on it
column21: and it's a joke- nobody has ever jumped into a platformer and said "Hrm i wonder how you jump?". Instead
column22: tell us about the teleporters! I had over an hour of in-game time before I knew WTF they were or how they worked- i just kept getting randomly teleported to other places and had no clue why. Or how about explain wtf the powerups are or when/why they might be useful? Experimentation is great
column23: but when I'm getting analy penetrated by a guy with glowing armor and a rocket launcher that phases through solid walls it's kinda hard
column24: yeah? The "Collector" game mode has great potential but so many people don't know how to play it because the only time you ever see instructions are on a loading screen
column25: and even then they're super vague. What are the red walls? Sometimes they turn green and you can go through? Under what conditions do they turn green? Is it a timer? did somebody press a button? Information like this is ridiculously easy to communicate to the player
column26: so it's frustrating to run into issues like this.\n\nThe UI is a complete mess- finding things on the main menu is a challenge
column27: as the sections of the menu sometimes don't make any sense. For example- the area where you equip items you've unlocked is called "album". I could think of 100 different words that would better describe that section of the menu- here's an easy one "ITEMS"
column28: or "INVENTORY".\nThe in-game HUD isn't much better. You get helpful arrows showing the direction of other players on the screen if they're within range
column29: but information that is immediately useful (such as which powerup you're carrying) is pushed to the margins of the screen
column30: forcing you to take your eyes off the action.\n\nI played most of my time using mouse and keyboard
column31: but also tried out gamepad so I could do a thorough review- gamepad support is barely there. I mean
column32: you can use a gamepad and the game will work- but good luck figuring out which buttons to press
column33: because all of the on-screen instructions will remain keyboard commands. Cycling weapons on the gamepad is a nightmare.. using bumpers to cycle through weapons? C'mon
column34: it's 2016- use a weapon wheel.. infinitely faster and actually possible to utilize muscle memory rather than tap-tap-tapping while you stare at the tiny icons under your character hoping you picked the right one.\n\nI've got other gripes with this game
column35: but I'm going to stop here because I'm ready to be done with this game in every sense of the word."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nHolodrive, previously known as Project Tilt, was released for Steam in early 2016, by Brazillian studio BitCake Studio. Described by the creators as Mario Kart meets Quake

hoursPlayed: fly and shoot their enemies into mixed nuts and bolts. Imagine Metal Slug
voteText: Contra
helpfulPercent: Shoot Many Robots or even Thing Thing. Now place that gameplay in a 2d arena with other players
votesHelpful: and weapons and powerups to freely pick up and replenish as long as you stay alive. Now add a community with in-game purchases for cosmetics and different gun loadouts. Then make each player's character a robotic dummy which can be dressed up as yo please. Now you have Holodrive in a nutshell

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A mix of worms and Rayman M but in 2D, I miss this kind of games.
If there will be the run mode, I'll finally be happy.
There is a tutorial but the game is very easy and intuitive.
Tthere are in app purchases but they are not so bothering so it's ok until you'll not be forced to use them to proceed in the game.
There must be added shortcut such as you exit using esc and the quit button must be made bigger, but it's ok.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A fun, casual game. It reminds me a lot of a title I used to play called The Showdown Effect. Basically, it's a 2D arena-style shooter.

You have a target reticle that guides where your bullets go, but, unlike The Showdown Effect, your bullets are projectiles that hit everything in front of and behind the reticle, instead of only what is underneath. This makes aiming in this game extremely easy for anyone to pick up.

The game, though, is extremely casual and battles can be largely determined by the items a player holds. If you get into a duel with a player who has the Disarm" powerup
recommended: he can literally knock the gun out of your hands from half a screen away for 5 seconds. In a game where it only takes 2 seconds to kill someone
hoursPlayed: this is a death sentence. Other powerups such as an invicible force-field
voteText: 2x damage (which
helpfulPercent: combined with the already low TTK can kill enemies in a second) are not much better for creating fair fights.\n\nAs a future free-to-play game
votesTotal: I wont hesitate to recommend this to anyone interested in playing a casual

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo good game, but needs more people and more maps.

Early Access Review

AWESOME WORK! This game is one of the most addictive I have ever played. I got it for free (luckily you can if you are fast enough and follow the instructions here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v-KyOshSA5k ) and now I am level 19.

If you are looking for a good time you should play it. Have you ever tried Quake? Have you ever played Mario Kart? If those great games had a son, that would be Holodrive.

Recommend it 10/10 would kill myself with the grenade launcher again.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

This game is good, not going to say anything about micro transactions because i havnet seen them effecting the game basically at all. The UI is bad. Some people been complaning about the match making but ive been having no issues what so ever so pass there. The main problem. Its not a very skillful game. Here are the skills i can see in this game. Basic k+m usage, Speed, and who ever gets to the weapon first. As soon as u pick up nearly any pickup. Theres 3 kills confirmed for you, no matter what. Its just annoying that this is how the games are played. Who every reaches an item first, and the thing is, its not like items are rare and spread around the map. No there is an item pick up every 5 steps away. Like theres sometimes even too many pick ups on some maps!!! Another thing, maps are ok but not very many of them due to the fact its early access and yes take this with a grain of salt its early access everything could change


Over all 6/10.
Not worth $5 but if its on sale or something might be worth picking it up to see if you enjoy side scrolling shooters.
(Note i got this game for free off failMID)

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Game has a fast pace and its pretty fun, although maybe too hectic for its own good sometimes.

Feels very rubberbandy, I have some serious as if" moments where on my screen someone is running right in front of my face but my bullets pass right through them. It says my ping is fine
date: and often times the other players ping is fine too
recommended: it just feels weird. Sometimes projectiles feel like they dont render/hit where they're not supposed to (rockets are a huge culprit of this).\n\nNeeds a gamemode selection
hoursPlayed: I know the game is closed beta and player counts are low but deathmatch is boring.\n\nFinally
voteText: why are there weapons behind your random cosmetic system.\nPlease don't put functionality behind walls like that. Have as much randomly rolling for dumb hats as you want
helpfulPercent: just take the weapons out of that system and put them somewhere else
votesHelpful: I wouldn't even mind if they were levling rewards.\n\nBeyond those complaints I've enjoyed most the matches I've played well enough."
